intro: Hieracium caesium f. valdefloccosum, commonly known as the white hawk's-beard, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its pale yellow to white flowers, which are typically arranged in a single, showy head. The plant has hairy, glandular leaves that are often lobed or toothed, contributing to its distinctive appearance. It thrives in open, disturbed habitats such as meadows and roadsides. This form is a variant of Hieracium caesium, distinguished by its reduced florets and more compact growth habit.
